observationText: The NF1flox4/Arg681*;Dhh-Cre mice develop neurofibromas along the spinal column, with disrupted axon myelination and collagen deposits observed in the tumor ultrastructure.

The NF1flox4/Arg681*;Dhh-Cre mice exhibit robust biallelic inactivation of Nf1 in primitive glial precursor cells during early embryogenesis (~E12.5), resulting in diffuse and rapidly growing plexiform neurofibromas.

The NF1flox4/Arg681*;Dhh-Cre mice have a greatly reduced lifespan, with all mice requiring sacrifice by 13 months due to paralysis, lethargy, weight loss and dehydration correlated with extensive tumor formation in peripheral and cranial nerve trunks and roots.
The NF1flox4/Arg681*;Dhh-Cre mice exhibit a 30-50% recombination efficiency of the Nf1 gene in primitive glial precursor cells when Cre is expressed under the Dhh promoter.
Cre-mediated recombination in the NF1flox4 allele results in a premature stop codon at amino acid position 681 (p.Arg681*), leading to a truncated neurofibromin protein.
